body: @jac1013 This task is yours, please go ahead keeping in mind [this](http://www.tpc2.com/dev/principles). If any questions, don't hesitate to ask right here
@jac1013 The budget here is **30 mins**, which is exactly how much time will be paid for, when the task is completed
@dmarkov sorry for this question, but what I understand here is that I must do a POST and GET to the github API via Java and represent the data as the interface says is expected, right?
@dmarkov I'm planning to start on this but I have doubts I don't want to make a mess (this is my first ticket), can you please clarify them for me?

take a look how similar methods are implemented in other classes, for example in `RtIssues`. in your unit test you don't need to connect to Github, we're using mocking instead. see how it's done in other unit tests, for example `RtIssuesTest`

issue.body: Puzzle `121-27fffa43` in `src/test/java/com/jcabi/github/RtForksITCase.java:40-42` has to be resolved: Create an integration test case for RtForks that fetches from a real Github repository. The test should exercise the iteration of existing forks and creation of new forks.

body: @yegor256 you told me twice to check RtIssues and learn how should I make the request, but there is not Request object for RtForks, should I add it? RtIssues receives its Request object in a constructor and there it setup the github url API from where it will request, is this what you are referring to? adding the Request object and making the same behaviour in the constructor for RtForks?

issue.title: Forks.create() and Forks.get() should return a Repo instance

repository.name: jcabi-github
repository.description: Java Object-Oriented Wrapper of GitHub API, with a fake implementation of the entire GitHub API (for your tests)

issue.body:
In current implementation `Forks.create()` and `Forks.get()` operate with Fork entity. But `Fork` in fact is a `Repo`.
So, it would be great to fix this inconsistency:
1) Fork entity should be removed
2) `Forks.iterate()` and `Forks.create()` should return `Repo`
3) Unit and integration tests should be fixed

Thank you

P.S. This task affects issues #192 #216 #185

issue.title: issue #216
